official-title.#text:
To authorize the Attorney General to exempt certain products from the requirements of subsections
			 (d) and (e) of section 310 of the Controlled Substances Act if it is not
			 practical to use such products in the illicit manufacture of
			 methamphetamine.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on the

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Meth Labs and Enhance Patient Access Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#text:
if the Attorney General determines that the product cannot be used in the illicit manufacture of
			 methamphetamine

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that it is not practical by processes known to be employed by
			 clandestine laboratory operators to use the product in the illicit
			 manufacture of methamphetamine

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 310(e)(3) of the Controlled Substances Act

header.#text: Exemption if it is not practical to use product in illicit manufacture of methamphetamine
